intro: Cyclobothra elegans var. lutea, commonly known as the golden cyclobothra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, cylindrical flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
